name: sdk/ESigEventHandlers.js
ESigEventHandlers
description: eSig UI SDK class. Used as separate SDK class for eSig UI applications.

name: ESIGUI_captureEvent
description: This method is invoked whenever runtime executes the "capture event" action in eSigUI

params.name: data
params.description: event data

params.name: data.fieldName
params.description: name of a field that generated the event

params.name: data.fieldType
params.description: type of a field that generated the event

params.name: data.fieldValue
params.description: value of a field that generated the event

params.name: data.eventType
params.description: type of the event on a field that generated the capture event (e.g. 'click', 'valuechanged', etc.)

name: ESIGUI_acceptDisclosure
description: This method is invoked whenever runtime executes the "accept disclosure" action in eSigUI.

name: ESIGUI_acceptConsent
description: This method is invoked whenever runtime executes the "accept consent" action in eSigUI.

name: ESIGUI_declineDisclosure
description: This method is invoked whenever runtime executes the "decline disclosure" action in eSigUI.

name: ESIGUI_declineConsent
description: This method is invoked whenever runtime executes the "decline consent" action in eSigUI.

name: ESIGUI_viewPDF
description: This method is invoked whenever runtime executes the "view PDF" action in eSigUI (not to be confused with generic "view PDF", which is not eSig-specific)

name: ESIGUI_getSigningStatus
description: This method is invoked whenever runtime executes the "get signing status" action in eSigUI (after the nested application receives a post message about signature completion)

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - promise of signing status

return.description: promise of signing status

name: ESIGUI_getVendorURL
description: This method is invoked whenever runtime executes the "get vendor URL" action in eSigUI

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<String>} - promise of the vendor URL

return.description: promise of the vendor URL

name: initialLoadData
description: This method is invoked when nested application Runtime attempts to initialize with external data that has been transmitted from host application.

unknown.tagValue: {undefined}

params.name: data
params.description: ClientData from the host application, see format description in `SD Runtime fields data`;

name: ESIGUI_finishSigning
description: This method is invoked whenever runtime executes the "finish signing" action in eSigUI

name: ESIGUI_copyNestedData
description: This method is invoked whenever runtime executes the "Copy data from Nested to Parent Version" action in eSigUI

name: requestAuthToken
description: This helper method knows how to get authentication token for requests to esig service.

unknown.tagValue: {string}

name: sdk/GlobalEventHandlers.js
GlobalEventHandlers
description: Base SDK class.

name: coreApi
description: Reference to SDK API functions.

name: superclass
description:
Superclass definition to provide access to implementation of base methods from SDK.
NOTE: default SDK implementation doesn't have any logic in base methods.

name: callCustomAssembly
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime makes a call to custom assembly (excluding custom assemblies for SourceGrid and SourceDropdown data retrieval).

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations. If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

params.name: assemblyName
params.description: name of custom assembly to call

return.description: A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations. If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

name: callJsCustomAssembly
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime makes a call to JavaScript custom assembly. Invocation occurs synchronously for Rule and Event action. It is allowed to return Promise and execute asynchronous code ONLY for Event action.

unknown.tagValue: {undefined|Promise} - If implementation is synchronous you may return either undefined or resolved Promise. Return Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations only valid for Event action.

params.name: assemblyName
params.description: name of JavaScript custom assembly to call

return.description: If implementation is synchronous you may return either undefined or resolved Promise. Return Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations only valid for Event action.

name: callServerProcedure
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime makes a call to server procedure.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations. If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

params.name: procedureName
params.description: name of server procedure to call

return.description: A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations. If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

name: applyEsign
description: Specific iGo method to apply e-signature

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.applyEsign (superclass.applyEsign returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

return.description: A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.applyEsign (superclass.applyEsign returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

name: declineEsign
description: Specific iGo method to decline e-signature

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.declineEsign (superclass.declineEsign returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

return.description: A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.declineEsign (superclass.declineEsign returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

name: activateFormPackage
description: Specific iGo method to activate form package

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.activateFormPackage (superclass.activateFormPackage returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

return.description: A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.activateFormPackage (superclass.activateFormPackage returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

name: viewPDF
description: Specific iGo method to prepare data before showing pdf

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.viewPDF (superclass.viewPDF returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

return.description: A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.viewPDF (superclass.viewPDF returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

name: exportFormFromIGO
description: This method is @deprecated and will be removed in nearest time. Use viewPDF() instead.

name: getSourceGridData
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to retrieve data for a SourceGrid.

unknown.tagValue: {String|Promise} - stringified JSON Array or Promise of such Array which contains data for Source Grid. You must return a Promise if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.getSourceGridData (superclass.getSourceGridData returns a Promise that resolves to requested data). If implementation is synchronous you may return either Promise resolved to stringified JSON Array or just stringified JSON Array with data.

params.name: assemblyName
params.description: name of custom assembly which returns Source Grid data, could be either JS or Server side custom assembly

properties.name: JSON_Array[]
properties.description: data object specifying data for single Source Grid row

properties.name: JSON_Array[].row-id
properties.description: unique row id

properties.name: JSON_Array[].<column_name>
properties.description: value for specified <column_name> in current row

return.description: stringified JSON Array or Promise of such Array which contains data for Source Grid. You must return a Promise if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.getSourceGridData (superclass.getSourceGridData returns a Promise that resolves to requested data). If implementation is synchronous you may return either Promise resolved to stringified JSON Array or just stringified JSON Array with data.

name: getSourceDropdownData
description:
This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to retrieve data for a SourceDropdown.
NOTE: its implementation should call services in background (don't use load progress indicator)
to avoid source dropdown list being closed after the data is loaded.

unknown.tagValue: {String|Promise} - stringified JSON Object or a Promise of such object which contains data for Source Dropdown. You must return a Promise if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.getSourceDropdownData (superclass.getSourceDropdownData returns a Promise that resolves to requested data). If implementation is synchronous you may return either Promise resolved to stringified JSON Object or just stringified JSON Object with data.

params.name: assemblyName
params.description: name of custom assembly which returns Source Dropdown data, could be either JS or Server side custom assembly

properties.name: JSON_Object.records[]
properties.description: array of records, each representing single data item for Source Dropdown

properties.name: JSON_Object.records[].name
properties.description: Required. Item name (will be displayed in dropdown control)

properties.name: JSON_Object.records[].value
properties.description: Required. Item value (internal data value)

properties.name: JSON_Object.records[].*
properties.description: Optional. Any other supplementary data for a record

return.description: stringified JSON Object or a Promise of such object which contains data for Source Dropdown. You must return a Promise if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.getSourceDropdownData (superclass.getSourceDropdownData returns a Promise that resolves to requested data). If implementation is synchronous you may return either Promise resolved to stringified JSON Object or just stringified JSON Object with data.

name: validateCreditCard
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to validate credit card data via specific services.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - Promise of the validateCreditCard operation completion. Resolving data format is the same as for @{creditCardData} param

params.name: creditCardData
params.description: filled in credit card data. Also contains extra parameters from client data. See `SD Runtime CreditCard control data` in Data Interchange Format description

params.name: cardType
params.description: Visa, AmEx, MasterCard, etc...

params.name: ftniRequestOptions
params.description: Request options to be sent to FTNI service (defaultStatus, doNotUpdateCustomer, doNotUseCustomerName, doNotUseCustomerAddress)

return.description: Promise of the validateCreditCard operation completion. Resolving data format is the same as for @{creditCardData} param

name: changeCreditCard
description: This method is used to erase previously entered credit card data.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Promise of the changeCreditCard operation completion. No data need to be resolved

params.name: creditCardControlName
params.description: name of credit card control to be erased

return.description: Promise of the changeCreditCard operation completion. No data need to be resolved

name: verifyEmail
description: This method is invoked whenever email control makes a call to validate email.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - Promise of operation completion which should resolve an object

params.name: email
params.description: email to validate

params.name: verificationService
params.description: verification service provider. One of ['kickbox']

properties.name: Object.status
properties.description: Required. Status of validation operation. One of ['valid', 'invalid', 'error', 'unverified']

properties.name: Object.message
properties.description: Optional message about validation execution on service

return.description: Promise of operation completion which should resolve an object

name: getSmartyStreetsPredictions
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to receive Smarty Streets Address Predictions

params.name: value
params.description: according to this value address predictions will be suggested

name: getGooglePlacesPredictions
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to receive Google Places Address Predictions

params.name: value
params.description: according to this value address predictions will be suggested

name: getSmartyStreetsDetails
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to receive Smarty Streets Address Details

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - Smarty Streets address details

params.name: value
params.description: according to this value address details will be received

properties.name: country
properties.description: country

properties.name: city
properties.description: city

properties.name: state
properties.description: state

properties.name: address
properties.description: address

properties.name: zip
properties.description:
zip code
Example of output data:
{
   address: "222 Vellenorth Rd",
   city: "Blue Ridge",
   country: "US",
   state: "GA",
   zip: "30513-2813"
}

return.description: Smarty Streets address details

name: getGooglePlacesDetails
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to receive Google Places Address Details

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - Google Places address details

params.name: value
params.description: according to this value address details will be received

properties.name: country
properties.description: country

properties.name: city
properties.description: city

properties.name: state
properties.description: state

properties.name: address
properties.description: address

properties.name: zip
properties.description:
zip code
Example of output data:
{
   address: "1085-1087 Boylston Street",
   city: "Boston",
   country: "USA",
   state: "MA",
   zip: "02215"
}

return.description: Google Places address details

name: saveData
description:
This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to save data.
All runtime data is available via API.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Promise of the save operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.saveData (superclass.saveData returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined. Note that this action is not expected to provide any data to runtime upon return. If you need to modify runtime data inside this action handler, use coreApi.updateRuntimeData().

return.description: Promise of the save operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.saveData (superclass.saveData returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined. Note that this action is not expected to provide any data to runtime upon return. If you need to modify runtime data inside this action handler, use coreApi.updateRuntimeData().

name: initialLoadData
description:
This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to initialize with external data. Data could be loaded either synchronously or asynchronously.
To load data synchronously pass it as a parameter. To load data asynchronously call the method without any parameters

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise|undefined} - Promise of the load operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.loadData (superclass.loadData returns a Promise).
If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined. Note that this action is not expected to provide any data to runtime upon return.
If you need to modify runtime data inside this action handler, use coreApi.updateRuntimeData().

params.name: data
params.description: data to be loaded into runtime

return.description:
Promise of the load operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.loadData (superclass.loadData returns a Promise).
If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined. Note that this action is not expected to provide any data to runtime upon return.
If you need to modify runtime data inside this action handler, use coreApi.updateRuntimeData().

name: loadData
description:
This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to load data. Data could be loaded either synchronously or asynchronously.
To load data synchronously pass it as a parameter. To load data asynchronously call the method without any parameters

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise|undefined} - Promise of the load operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.loadData (superclass.loadData returns a Promise).
If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined. Note that this action is not expected to provide any data to runtime upon return.
If you need to modify runtime data inside this action handler, use coreApi.updateRuntimeData().

params.name: data
params.description: data to be loaded into runtime

return.description:
Promise of the load operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.loadData (superclass.loadData returns a Promise).
If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined. Note that this action is not expected to provide any data to runtime upon return.
If you need to modify runtime data inside this action handler, use coreApi.updateRuntimeData().

name: sendEmail
description: Specific iGo method to trigger sending email to clickwrap users

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.sendEmail (superclass.sendEmail returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

return.description: A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.sendEmail (superclass.sendEmail returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

name: retrieveParamedSchedulerUrl
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime makes a call to receive url to scheduler for selected paramed service.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - Promise of operation completion which should resolve to an object;

params.name: controlName
params.description: name of paramed control;

params.name: service
params.description: selected paramed service;

properties.name: Object.url
properties.description: Required. Url to scheduler service;

return.description: Promise of operation completion which should resolve to an object;

name: checkParamedSchedulerStatus
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime makes a call to check status of scheduling.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - Promise of operation completion which should resolve to an object;

params.name: controlName
params.description: name of paramed control;

properties.name: Object.schedulingDone
properties.description: Required. Boolean flag that inform about finishing scheduling;

return.description: Promise of operation completion which should resolve to an object;

name: callLogger
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to log something

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Object>} - A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.callLogger (superclass.callLogger returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

return.description: A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.callLogger (superclass.callLogger returns a Promise). If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

name: uploadFile
description:
This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to upload file
if method called and implemented according to example, user will see modal window with upload file form and with attachments list otherwise you can create your own implementation for upload file form and show attachments list and render it via coreApi showModal method or in a different way

params.name: defaultFileName
params.description: default file name from event action;

name: showAttachments
description:
This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to show attachments
if method called and implemented according to example, user will see modal window with attachments list otherwise you can create your own implementation for show attachments list and render it via coreApi showModal method or in a different way

name: onDynamicTableEvent
description: This method is invoked as a reaction on events happening inside dynamic table control. It's expected that the abstract logic inside would be the next: depending on event type some changes could be made to the control state via specific coreApi method. Then, calling coreApi.refreshUI method, changes to the control state will be applied in UI (control will be re-rendered). See `SD Runtime DynamicTable control data` in Data Interchange Format description for details relating to the state of DynamicTable field (how it's stored in runtime core and available here via coreApi methods).
examples:
Args by type:
   - tableInit
         no args
   - editorClick
       - columnName
       - rowId

   - editorValueChange
       - columnName
       - rowId
       - value

   - editorFocus
       - columnName
       - rowId

   - editorBlur
       - columnName
       - rowId

   - sortChange
       - columnName
       - direction

   - pageChange
      - page

   - itemsPerPageChange
      - itemsPerPageChange

params.name: tableFieldName
params.description: name of field ( given in property card in designer)

params.name: type
params.description: name of the event

params.name: args
params.description: specific to event type arguments.

params.name: args.columnName
params.description: name of a column where event is happening

params.name: args.rowId
params.description: index of a row where event is happening

params.name: args.value
params.description: value of an editor passed in `editorValueChange` event

params.name: args.direction
params.description: sorting direction for a column

params.name: args.page
params.description: page number for changing page event

params.name: args.itemsPerPageChange
params.description: itemsPerPageChange for changing items per page event

name: ValidationType
description: Type of validation examination, like isRequired, minLength, etc...

name: ValidationResult
description: Result of validation performed be runtime core as an object with metadata (contains validation result and optional message)

properties.name: validity
properties.description: result of validation performed by runtime core

properties.name: validationMessage
properties.description: validation message which is attached to validation result by runtime core

name: Validations
description: Validation object which comes as argument to onFieldValidate

name: onFieldValidate
description:
This method is invoked by runtime core as a hook to internal field validation.
Invocation happens right before validation results of different validators (isRequired, maxLength, etc...), which are setup for a specific field,
will be merged into final validation status for the field (whether field is valid or not) by the runtime core.
This means that here you have full control over validation mechanism of runtime core: you can rewrite
result just for one validator in series (for example you'd like to override how isRequired should be calculated for a mask control field) or
you can deny all validations made by runtime core and perform your validations here.

NOTE: Be careful with performance, this method is invoked frequently.

params.name: field
params.description: object containing all properties of the field (type, name, label, etc...)

params.name: data
params.description: state of a control (its value, formattedValue, etc...). See Data Interchange Format description to find out format of field state by its type

params.name: validations
params.description: contains performed validations with results of validations for current field by runtime core

return.description:
modified validations with custom validations performed in this method.
Returning object from this function signals to runtime core that this SDK method customizes validation.
Returning any other value signals that no custom validations are performed by this SDK method so validation calculated by the runtime core itself will be applied.
Returning empty object signals to runtime core that field must be valid (as no validations performed) and all validations performed by the runtime core itself should be ignored

name: sdk/RuntimeCoreAPI.js
DEFAULT_API_LOADER_ID
description:
SDK API class.
Provides implementations to use in SDK

name: RuntimeCoreAPI
description: Runtime Core API

name: clientDataAdapter
description: Provides access to existing data adapters
examples:
const clientData = this.api.getRuntimeData();
const transformedClientData = this.api.clientDataAdapter.iGo.transformDataToSave(clientData);

properties.name: iGo
properties.description: data adapter for iGo

properties.name: iGo.transformDataToSave
properties.description: function to transform data from runtime to server format, to use before saving on server

properties.name: iGo.transformLoadedData
properties.description: function to transform data loaded from server into runtime format, to adapt data loaded from server

properties.name: iGoDirtyData
properties.description: dirty data adapter for iGo

properties.name: iGoDirtyData.transformDataToSave
properties.description: function to transform dirty data from runtime to server format, to use before saving on server

properties.name: iGoDirtyData.transformLoadedData
properties.description: function to transform dirty data loaded from server into runtime format, to adapt data loaded from server

name: serviceRequestProvider
description: Object that contains methods for making pre-configured external calls
examples: const result = this.coreApi.serviceRequestProvider.callService(assemblyName, transformedClientData, runtimeState, shouldCallInBackground)

name: sdkEventHandlerNames
description: Definition of SDK event handlers' names. To be used when overriding implementations of SDK event handlers.
examples: var saveDataHandlerName = this.coreApi.sdkEventHandlerNames.SAVE_DATA;

name: Promise
description: Cross-browser implementation of JS Promise. To use wherever SDK expects params of Promise type.
examples: return this.coreApi.Promise.resolve(data);

name: getRuntimeData
description: Gets form values client data

return.description: data with field names as keys

name: getRuntimeDirtyData
description: Gets "dirty" form values client data. The data is considered "dirty" if it was modified since last execution of "resetDirtyData" API method. Note: "resetDirtyData" is implicitly executed upon loading data from iGo in "saveData", "callCustomAssembly" and other similar methods.

return.description: data with field names as keys

name: resetDirtyData
description: Resets "dirty" state of client data. See description of "getRuntimeDirtyData" API method.
examples: this.coreApi.resetDirtyData();

name: updateRuntimeData
description: Updates runtime state
examples:
<caption>Legacy caseData format</caption>
this.coreApi.updateRuntimeData({
    caseData: [{
        name: 'PI_FirstName',
        value: 'Andrew',
        formattedValue: 'Andrew'
    }],
    metaData: {
        cossFORMS_FORMS_LastHiddenScreens: [],
        cossFORMS_FORMS_LastScreenName: "Screen1"
    },
    shouldReplaceSavedData: false
});

<caption>caseData format used in "getRuntimeData" API method</caption>
this.coreApi.updateRuntimeData({
    caseData: {
        PI_FirstName: {
            value: 'Andrew',
            formattedValue: 'Andrew'
        }
    },
    metaData: {
        cossFORMS_FORMS_LastHiddenScreens: [],
        cossFORMS_FORMS_LastScreenName: "Screen1"
    },
    shouldReplaceSavedData: false
});

params.name: data
params.description: runtime state data to set

params.name: data.caseData
params.description: form values data array or object

params.name: data.metaData
params.description: metadata object

params.name: data.shouldReplaceSavedData
params.description: set "true" if provided data should entirely replace existing runtime data, set "false" if only provided values should be replaced in existing runtime data

params.name: data.hasAttachment
params.description: set "true" if Attachment controls should be displayed in Navigation panel

params.name: data.eliminatedAndEmptyFields
params.description: array of controls for which their default values need to be restored

name: restoreDefaultValues
description:
Restores default values (if any) for specified fields. Won't restore in the following cases:
- field is hidden
- field is not a screen item
- field already has a value
- screen containing a field was visited
examples: this.coreApi.restoreDefaultValues(['address1', 'amount_of_something']);

params.name: fieldNames
params.description: array of field names to attempt restoring default values for

name: refreshUI
description: Updates runtime UI according to runtime state
examples:
this.coreApi.refreshUI(true); // force running rules
this.coreApi.refreshUI(); // rules would be run according to internal logic of runtime core

params.name: forceRunRules
params.description:
normally rules should run without this flag but under certain circumstances rules wouldn't run.
If you still need to run rules under certain circumstances pass `true`.
WARNING: don't pass `true` until you really need it. This could affect performance.
`false` by default

name: runtimeStateItems
description: Definition of runtime state object items' names. To be used in in updateRuntimeState() and getRuntimeState() methods.
examples:
var clientDataKey = this.coreApi.runtimeStateItems.CLIENT_DATA;
var clientData = getRuntimeState(clientDataKey);

properties.name: runtimeStateItems.CLIENT_DATA
properties.description: key for runtime form values client data

properties.name: runtimeStateItems.USER_DATA
properties.description: key for user data

properties.name: runtimeStateItems.PREVIOUS_SCREEN
properties.description: key for a screen that had been active before event handler was called

properties.name: runtimeStateItems.CURRENT_SCREEN
properties.description: key for a currently active screen

properties.name: runtimeStateItems.SCREENS_VISIBILITY
properties.description: key for hidden screens' names array

properties.name: runtimeStateItems.SCREENS_VALIDITY
properties.description: key for the object which contains screens' validity statuses

properties.name: runtimeStateItems.SOFT_LOCK_STATUS
properties.description: key for the soft lock status

properties.name: runtimeStateItems.HARD_LOCK_STATUS
properties.description: key for the hard lock status

name: getRuntimeState
description: Gets either all or specified runtime state items. Specified items' keys should match the ones defined in runtimeStateItems. Note: the list of acceptable/returned items corresponds to runtimeStateItems, which might be extended in future.
examples: const runtimeState = this.coreApi.getRuntimeState();

unknown.tagValue: {Object} runtime state data

params.name: itemNames
params.description: name (or array of names) of runtime state item(s) to retrieve. If not specified, all available items will be returned.

properties.name: data[runtimeStateItems.CLIENT_DATA]
properties.description: form values client data items

properties.name: data[runtimeStateItems.USER_DATA]
properties.description: user data items (read only)

properties.name: data[runtimeStateItems.PREVIOUS_SCREEN]
properties.description: name of screen which was active before SDK action was invoked

properties.name: data[runtimeStateItems.CURRENT_SCREEN]
properties.description: name of current screen

properties.name: data[runtimeStateItems.SCREENS_VISIBILITY]
properties.description: all screens' visibility statuses (true = visible, false = hidden)

properties.name: data[runtimeStateItems.SCREENS_VALIDITY]
properties.description: all screens' validity statuses

properties.name: data[runtimeStateItems.SOFT_LOCK_STATUS]
properties.description: statuses of all softlock categories

properties.name: data[runtimeStateItems.HARD_LOCK_STATUS]
properties.description: true if the case is hard-locked

return.description: runtime state data

name: restoreRuntimeState
description: Restores runtime state items (removes existing and applies the supplied data). Disregards internal logical data interconnections (e.g. will restore client data disregarding whether corresponding screen items are locked). Note: the list of acceptable items corresponds to runtimeStateItems, which might be extended in future.

unknown.tagValue: undefined

params.name: data
params.description: data to set into runtime. Object keys should match the ones defined in runtimeStateItems.

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.CLIENT_DATA]
params.description: form values client data items

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.CURRENT_SCREEN]
params.description: name of screen to set as current

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.SCREENS_VISIBILITY]
params.description: visibility statuses of screens (true = visible, false = hidden)

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.SCREENS_VALIDITY]
params.description: validity statuses of screens (possible values: 'pristine', 'valid', 'invalid')

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.SOFT_LOCK_STATUS]
params.description: object with key: softlock category value: true/false (e.g. { Default: true } will lock screens with Default softlock category)

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.HARD_LOCK_STATUS]
params.description: true to apply hard lock to all screens

return.description: undefined

name: updateRuntimeState
description: Updates runtime state items. Accounts for internal logical data interconnections (e.g. will not restore client data items if corresponding screen items are locked), so if you are updating several state items in one updateRuntimeState call (e.g. both locks and client data) some of the values may not apply due to logical data contradictions. It might make sense to split the single update operation into several updates, e.g.: updateRuntimeState(clientData) and updateRuntimeState(lockStatuses). Note: the list of acceptable items corresponds to runtimeStateItems, which might be extended in future.

unknown.tagValue: undefined

params.name: data
params.description: data to set into runtime. Object keys should match the ones defined in runtimeStateItems.

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.CLIENT_DATA]
params.description: form values client data items

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.CURRENT_SCREEN]
params.description: name of screen to set as current

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.SCREENS_VISIBILITY]
params.description: visibility statuses of screens

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.SCREENS_VALIDITY]
params.description: validity statuses of screens

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.SOFT_LOCK_STATUS]
params.description: object with key: softlock category value: true/false (e.g. { Default: true } will lock screens with Default softlock category)

params.name: data[runtimeStateItems.HARD_LOCK_STATUS]
params.description: true to apply hard lock to all screens

return.description: undefined

name: resetRuntimeState
description: Resets values of runtime state items. Note: the list of acceptable items corresponds to runtimeStateItems, which might be extended in future.

unknown.tagValue: undefined

params.name: itemNames
params.description: name (or array of names) of runtime state item(s) to reset. If not specified, all available items will be reset.

params.name: runtimeStateItems.CLIENT_DATA
params.description: removes all form values client data items

params.name: runtimeStateItems.CURRENT_SCREEN
params.description: resets current screen to first available

params.name: runtimeStateItems.SCREENS_VISIBILITY
params.description: makes all screens visible

params.name: runtimeStateItems.SCREENS_VALIDITY
params.description: resets validity statuses of screens to "pristine"

params.name: runtimeStateItems.SOFT_LOCK_STATUS
params.description: removes soft lock for all softlock categories

params.name: runtimeStateItems.HARD_LOCK_STATUS
params.description: removes hard lock

return.description: undefined

name: getFieldByName
description: Retrieves all properties of the field with specified name. This is how you can get the item type, default value and other properties.
examples: this.coreApi.getFieldByName('myTextBox');

unknown.tagValue: {Object | null} found item or null

params.name: name
params.description: name of the client data item to retrieve

return.description: found item or null

name: getUserDataTypeByName
description: Retrieves user data item type by its name.
examples: this.coreApi.getUserDataTypeByName('CompanyID');

unknown.tagValue: {String | undefined} found data item type or undefined

params.name: name
params.description: name of the user data item to retrieve

return.description: found data item type or undefined

name: getStringProductPropertyByName
description: Retrieves product property value by its name.
examples: this.coreApi.getStringProductPropertyByName('CA_for_ViewPDF');

unknown.tagValue: {String | undefined} product property value or defaul value from ProductPropertiesConfig (if property was found). Otherwise - undefined.

params.name: name
params.description: name of the product property to retrieve

return.description: product property value or defaul value from ProductPropertiesConfig (if property was found). Otherwise - undefined.

name: showLoader
description: Shows splash screen with spinner. Practical for time-consuming operations.
examples:
this.coreApi.showLoader();
setTimeout(this.coreApi.hideLoader, 1000);

params.name: loaderId
params.description:
sometimes you need to show loaders for different purposes
         simultaneously and hide the loading spinner only after all of the loaders were hidden by calling `hideLoader`.
         This `loaderId` helps to queue loading operations

params.name: message
params.description: if not empty shows message under the spinner. Message would not be preserved for next loader (hide -> show)

name: hideLoader
description:
Hides splash screen with spinner.
NOTE: number of hideLoader calls should equal the number of previous showLoader calls to actually hide a progress screen.
examples:
this.coreApi.showLoader();
setTimeout(this.coreApi.hideLoader, 1000);

params.name: loaderId
params.description:
sometimes you need to show loaders for different purposes
         simultaneously and hide the loading spinner only after all of the loaders were hidden by calling `hideLoader`.
         This `loaderId` helps to queue loading operations

name: showModal
description: Show modal window on the screen.

params.name: modalWindowComponent
params.description: React Component or modal window body as html string

name: hideModal
description: Hide modal window on the screen.
examples: this.coreApi.hideModal();

name: removeFieldValues
description: Removes runtime field states/values by field names

params.name: fieldNames
params.description: names of fields to remove from client data

name: compactGridRows
description: Removes empty rows from all grids in runtime state

name: renderUploadFileComponent
description: Returns upload file container component.

unknown.tagValue: react component

params.name: props
params.description: properties for component

params.name: props.defaultFileName
params.description: default file name from event action

params.name: props.maxFileSize
params.description: max files size in bytes, default 1000000000

params.name: props.allowedFileTypes
params.description: array of allowed file types, default ['pdf', 'docx']

params.name: props.maxFileNameLength
params.description: max filename input length

params.name: props.maxDescriptionLength
params.description: max description input length

return.description: react component

name: renderShowAttachmentsComponent
description: Returns show attachments component.

unknown.tagValue: react component

return.description: react component

name: getApiEndpoint
description: Returns api endpoint by api method name

unknown.tagValue: {String} - apiEndpoint

return.description: apiEndpoint

name: generateIndexHtmlForNested
description: Prepare index html for the nested application.

params.name: versionRef
params.description: version id of nested application;

params.name: appStaticPath
params.description: root path of host application;

params.name: configs
params.description: object with following application configs: `appConfig`, `apiConfig`, `queryVariables`, `uiConfig`;

params.name: nestedAppScript
params.description: customization script that can be provided to do some work when nested app is loaded;

return.description: a promise of the index html to be built.

name: convertSmartyStreetsPredictions
description: Converts Smarty Streets predictions.

params.name: predictions
params.description: Smarty Streets predictions (https://smartystreets.com/docs/cloud/us-autocomplete-api)

name: convertGooglePlacesPredictions
description: Converts Google Places predictions.

params.name: predictions
params.description: Google Places predictions (https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/autocomplete#place_autocomplete_results)

name: parseSmartyStreetsAddress
description: Parses Smarty Streets address details.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - parsed Smarty Streets address details

params.name: addressDetails
params.description: Smarty Streets address details (https://smartystreets.com/docs/cloud/us-street-api)

properties.name: country
properties.description: country

properties.name: city
properties.description: city

properties.name: state
properties.description: state

properties.name: address
properties.description: address

properties.name: zip
properties.description:
zip code
Example of output data:
{
   address: "222 Vellenorth Rd",
   city: "Blue Ridge",
   country: "US",
   state: "GA",
   zip: "30513-2813"
}

return.description: parsed Smarty Streets address details

name: parseGooglePlacesAddress
description: Parses Google Places address details.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - parsed Google Places address details

params.name: addressDetails
params.description: Google Places address details (https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/details#PlaceDetailsResults)

properties.name: country
properties.description: country

properties.name: city
properties.description: city

properties.name: state
properties.description: state

properties.name: address
properties.description: address

properties.name: zip
properties.description:
zip code
Example of output data:
{
   address: "1085-1087 Boylston Street",
   city: "Boston",
   country: "USA",
   state: "MA",
   zip: "02215"
}

return.description: parsed Google Places address details

name: getDestiny
description: Get application destiny

return.description: application destiny value `application`, `clickwrap` or null;

name: openNextVisibleScreen
description:
Finds next visible screen, opens it and then waits asynchronously until it's open,
as changing screen triggers events which could have asynchronous effects (beforeloadscreen, beforeleavescreen, etc...).
A screen is considered open when it's fully rendered and waits for user interaction.
In other words after screen is rendered nothing should be changed by application itself (for example field validation change) until user interacts with the screen.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise<boolean>} - true, in case of next visible screen found and opened,
 false - in case of current screen is last visible or next visible screen wasn't opened

return.description:
true, in case of next visible screen found and opened,
 false - in case of current screen is last visible or next visible screen wasn't opened

name: openScreenByName
description:
Opens screen and waits asynchronously until it's open,
as changing screen triggers events which could have asynchronous effects (beforeloadscreen, beforeleavescreen, etc...).
A screen is considered open when it's fully rendered and waits for user interaction.
In other words after screen is rendered nothing should be changed by application itself (for example field validation change) until user interacts with the screen.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise<boolean>} - true, in case of screen found and opened,
 false - in case of screen wasn't opened

params.name: screenName
params.description: name of screen to open

return.description:
true, in case of screen found and opened,
 false - in case of screen wasn't opened

name: openFirstIncompleteScreen
description:
Opens first incomplete screen and waits asynchronously until it's open,
as changing screen triggers events which could have asynchronous effects (beforeloadscreen, beforeleavescreen, etc...).
A screen is considered open when it's fully rendered and waits for user interaction.
In other words after screen is rendered nothing should be changed by application itself (for example field validation change) until user interacts with the screen.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise<boolean>} - true, in case of first incomplete screen found and opened,
 false - in case of current screen is first incomplete screen wasn't opened

return.description:
true, in case of first incomplete screen found and opened,
 false - in case of current screen is first incomplete screen wasn't opened

name: updateFieldStateImmutably
description: Updates field state by it's name in immutable way

unknown.tagValue: {undefined}

params.name: fieldName
params.description: name of a field which state needs to be updated

params.name: updater
params.description:
updater function which takes control's state to which you need to perform changes.
The `updater` function has 1 argument: control's state (usually it's an object with `value`,`formattedValue`,`data` properties).
See https://immerjs.github.io/immer/docs/produce (immer.produce) for details of how `updater` works.

NOTE: Currently, it's impossible to work with `data` property in immutable way as it's being cloned on every update in runtime core

name: sdk/SDKESigEventHandlerNames.js
sdk/SDKEventHandlerNames.js
sdk/SharedGlobalEventHandlers.js
SharedGlobalEventHandlers
description: Shared SDK class. Added as a mixin to globally available SDK.

name: ESIGUI_startSigning
description: This method is invoked whenever Runtime attempts to open eSigUI.

params.name: versionRef
params.description: id of the version which represents the nested application

name: closeEsigUiApp
description: This method is invoked when nested application attempts to close eSigUI.

name: copyNestedData
description: This method is invoked when nested application attempts to copy eSigUI data.

params.name: data
params.description: mapped with nestedFieldsMapping and stringified nested client data

name: needToAutoValidateScreens
description:
Decides whether auto validation should start.
By default it looks if specific flag in client data is setup and case is not hard locked

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} - true, if auto validation should start, false if it isn't

return.description: true, if auto validation should start, false if it isn't

name: autoValidateScreens
description:
Starts auto validation of screens. Screens are open one by one in sequence automatically until last visible screen.
Auto validation starts from currently opened screen.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} - A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.autoValidateScreens.
If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

return.description:
A Promise of operation completion if implementation contains any asynchronous operations and/or call to superclass.autoValidateScreens.
If implementation is synchronous you may return either resolved Promise or undefined.

content:
# Screen Designer [![codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/ipipeline/ngen_screen_designer/branch/dev/graph/badge.svg?token=NQORvHqHIM)](https://codecov.io/gh/ipipeline/ngen_screen_designer) ### Build the project * install current NodeJs LTS (https://nodejs.org/en/) * install mongodb v4.* [MongoDB](http://www.mongodb.org/downloads) * on Windows install build toolchain as described in https://github.com/nodejs/node-gyp#on-windows * `npm install` for installing modules (if you see any errors then refer to section [Newrelic](#newrelic-for-development)) * `npm run serve` for running server * `npm run build` for running build ### Run development environment * `npm run dev` (or `npm run dev-plain` to build without source maps which will be faster) for running project in development mode (app is available on http://localhost:3000/) ### Code Style Guide * [JavaScript CodeStyle by airbnb](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/README.md) * [Prettier](https://prettier.io/docs/en/index.html) code formatter is used to automatically format you code on commit * `npm run lint` to lint code ### Technology requirements * **Instead of** `Immutable.js` use `immer` or `fast.js`. You can find `fast.js` in `src/utils/fast.js` ### Configs * .editorconfig - IDE config * .eslintrc.js - Linting config * .prettierrc - Prettier config * .babelrc - Babel config * .tsconfig - typescript config ### Running tests * `npm run unit-tests` (for running unit tests, \*.spec.js) * `npm run e2e` (for running end-to-end tests on database, API tests, \*.e2e.js) * `npm run ui-tests` (running UI tests, testing react components, \*-test.js) #### Testing strategy (which functionality should be covered by which tests) We have 3 types of tests which aimed to test different areas of application. Here is what should be tested in every test type. _UI:_
Every runtime component with internal business logic should have at least 80% percent coverage of business logic and arbitrary coverage for rendering logic. Snapshot testing should help here much. Consider https://jestjs.io/docs/en/snapshot-testing _UNIT:_
All related to runtime business logic should have at least 80% coverage. All units with complex business logic allover application should have at least 70% coverage. _API:_
All complex business logic should have at least 70% coverage with \*.e2e tests. For example, templates business logic should have at least 70% coverage. ### Initialize DB * `npm run add-db` ### Applying patch on DB * `npm run db-patch ` ### Install a new module * `npm install --save` (or --save-dev for development needs modules) ### Branching model Follow [GIT Flow](http://nvie.com/posts/a-successful-git-branching-model/) to create and work with branches. Create a branch from `dev`, check it out, do your work. Branch name should be in format: `[user story number]-[short description]`. Use `-` for separating. Example: `NGSD-2288-update-readme`. ### Before merge * See [checklist](https://kb.epam.com/display/IPLNSCRD/Code+review) * Check that tests and linter is OK on CI * If everything is OK - create pull request (PR) * Discuss and fix comments from your colleagues * Wait until PR is approved ### Git commit message style Your commit message should contain: 1. User story number from JIRA: e.g. `NGSD-2288`; 2. `` of your changes: feature/fix/refactor etc. 3. Description what you have done. 4. (Optional) You may add more descriptive commit message. Separate you main short commit message and Description by empty line. Allowed `` values: * feat (new feature) * fix (bug fix) * docs (changes to documentation) * style (formatting, missing semi colons, etc; no code change) * refactor (refactoring production code) * test (adding missing tests, refactoring tests; no production code change) * chore (updating grunt tasks etc; no production code change) ### Example of Ideal Commit message NGSD-2288 docs: Fixed 'git commit message style' section. Replace outdated information about karma commit style. Added missing information in 'installation' section. ### Version control * used semantic version * CI doing version update in dev for each new build by command `npm version --no-git-tag-version patch` * CI doing version update in dev-weekly for each new sprint by command `npm version --no-git-tag-version minor` ### ES6 features * [view es6](https://github.com/lukehoban/es6features) * [view es7](https://h3manth.com/new/blog/2015/es7-features/) ### IDE You can use any IDE you like if it is free or you have licence. We recommend Webstorm or VS Code ### WebStorm settings ### Newrelic for production You can configure license key and anything else in `newrelic.js` at root of project directory. Be aware that by default this file contains development license key and you are obliged to change it for production (property `license_key`). Also it's good to change `app_name`. ### Newrelic for development If you see error when running `npm i` related to inability to compile newrelic package try the following: 1. Run `npm install --global windows-build-tools` 2. Run `npm rebuild node-gyp` 3. Run `npm config set msvs_version 2017` 4. Run `npm i` 5. If previous 4 steps didn't help, install python v2.\* from('https://www.python.org/downloads/') and repeat steps 1-4. 6. If nothing helps try installing `https://www.visualstudio.com/thank-you-downloading-visual-studio/?sku=BuildTools&rel=15` as explained here: `https://github.com/nodejs/node-gyp/issues/1144#issuecomment-290253041` ### Typescript For details see [Typescript rules](TYPESCRIPT_RULES.md)
name: ./README.md
./src/runtime/sdk/SDK-user-guide.md
./src/runtime/sdk/CHANGELOG.md
content:
# Changelog

All notable changes to SDK will be documented in this file.

## [Unreleased]

* Think about moving SDK to separate repository
* Removed iGo references from SDK documentation

## [0.132.*]

### Added

* Runtime core API methods:
    - `removeFieldValues`: removes fields data from runtime state (useful for applying partial update to fields data)
    - `compactGridRows`: removes empty rows from all grids in runtime state (useful after applying update to grids data)

## [0.131.*]

### Added

* `onDynamicTableEvent` method is introduced in `GlobalEventHandlers` to react on events within DynamicTable control
* `onFieldValidate` method is introduced in `GlobalEventHandlers` to have ability to override fields validation provided by runtime core
* `updateFieldStateImmutably` method is introduced in `RuntimeCoreApi` to work with field's value\state immutably

## [0.111.*]

### Added

* `ESIGUI_copyNestedData` method is introduced in `ESigEventHandlers` to notify host application about
  copying data from Nested to Parent Version.

* `copyNestedData` method is introduced in `SharedGlobalEventHandlers` to handle copying data from Nested to Parent Version.

## [0.108.*]

### Changed

* Runtime core API methods:
    - **(Breaking)** `getRuntimeState`: softLockStatus field now returns an object instead of true/false with the following structure:
    `Key: softlockCategory (one of: Default, HIPAA, Part1, Part2)`
    `Value: true/false`
    If a value equals true then this category is locked and vice versa.
    `{ Default: true, HIPAA: false, Part1: true, Part2: false }`
    - **(Breaking)** `restoreRuntimeState`: softLockStatus field now accepts object with the structure described above instead of true/false
    Usage example: `runtimeCoreApi.restoreRuntimeState({`
        `softLockStatus: { Default: true, HIPAA: true, Part1: true, Part2: true }`
    `})`
    - **(Breaking)**`updateRuntimeState`: softLockStatus field now accepts object with the structure described above instead of true/false
    Usage example: `runtimeCoreApi.updateRuntimeState({`
        `softLockStatus: { Default: false, HIPAA: false, Part1: false, Part2: false }`
    `})`
    - `resetRuntimeState`: resets softlock for all categories if softLockStatus flag is in parameters array
    Usage example: `runtimeCoreApi.resetRuntimeState(['softLockStatus '])`

## [0.106.*]

### Added

* methods to shared SDK:
    - `needToAutoValidateScreens`
    - `autoValidateScreens`

* Runtime core API methods:
    - `openNextVisibleScreen`
    - `openScreenByName`
    - `openFirstIncompleteScreen`

### Changed

* Runtime core API methods:
    - `showLoader`: added new param - loaderId, added ability to pass custom message which would be shown under spinner and updated docs
    - `hideLoader`: added new param - loaderId, update docs
    - `renderUploadFileComponent` method receives now new properties: maxFileNameLength, maxDescriptionLength; method doesn't receive now next properties: uploadFileEndpoint, uploadSucceedCallback

## [0.102.*]

### Changed

* `activateFormPackage` method now supports two implementations via launchdarkly. Old one when the request is sent to server to perform an operation. New one when fields are updated on client side without any network activity, which should be faster.

## [0.97.*]

### Added

* New method to Esig SDK - `requestAuthToken`

## [0.96.*]

### Changed

* Changed the way CSS resources are loaded for the runtime application. See "Applying custom styles and fonts" section of the "SDK User Guide".

## [0.93.*]

### Changed

* Renamed method `ESIGUI_checkSigningStatus` to `ESIGUI_getSigningStatus`
* `validateCreditCard` request now sends additional options taken from fourth parameter:
  'ftniRequestOptions': defaultStatus, DoNotUpdateCustomer, DoNotUseCustomerName,
  DoNotUseCustomerAddress

## [0.92.2]

### Added

* `closeEsigUiApp` method introduced in `SharedGlobalEventHandlers` to handle closing eSigUI
  application.

### Changed

* `ESIGUI_finishSigning` method introduced in `ESigEventHandlers` to notify host application about
  closing.

## [0.92.*]

### Added

* `SharedGlobalEventHandlers` class. Its instance object is used to extend the `GlobalEventHandlers`
  with functionality to start eSigUI:
  * `ESIGUI_startSigning`
* `initialLoadData` method introduced in `ESigEventHandlers` to handle eSigUI initializing on
  application run;

### Changed

* `ESigEventHandlers` to independent SDK with eSigUI-specific functionality;
* Extract method `ESIGUI_startSigning` from `ESigEventHandlers` to `SharedGlobalEventHandlers` SDK;

## [0.91.*]

### Added

* Runtime core API methods: `convertSmartyStreetsPredictions`, `convertGooglePlacesPredictions`,
  `parseSmartyStreetsAddress`, `parseGooglePlacesAddress`, `getStringProductPropertyByName`
* Global Event Handlers: `getSmartyStreetsPredictions`, `getGooglePlacesPredictions`,
  `getSmartyStreetsDetails`, `getGooglePlacesDetails`

### Changed

* IGo Specific Global Event Handlers' method `viewPDF` now calls predefined CA if its name was
  specified.
* jQuery was updated to 3.3.1
* bootstrap was updated to 3.3.7 to support 3.x.x versions of jQuery

## [0.90.*]

### Added

* Runtime core API methods:
  * `getDestiny`

## [0.89.*]

### Added

* `ESigEventHandlers` class. Its instance object is used to extend the `GlobalEventHandlers` with
  eSigUI-specific functionality:
  * `ESIGUI_acceptConsent`
  * `ESIGUI_acceptDisclosure`
  * `ESIGUI_captureEvent`
  * `ESIGUI_checkSigningStatus`
  * `ESIGUI_declineConsent`
  * `ESIGUI_declineDisclosure`
  * `ESIGUI_finishSigning`
  * `ESIGUI_flushAuditTrail`
  * `ESIGUI_getVendorURL`
  * `ESIGUI_startSigning`
  * `ESIGUI_viewPDF`
* Runtime core API methods:
  * `generateIndexHtmlForNested`

## [0.87.*]

### Added

* Runtime core API methods: `renderUploadFileComponent`, `renderShowAttachmentsComponent`,
  `getApiEndpoint`
* Global Event Handlers: `uploadFile`, `showAttachments`

## [0.85.*]

### Added

* Runtime core API methods: `getUserDataTypeByName`
* Global Event Handlers: `retrieveParamedSchedulerUrl`, `checkParamedSchedulerStatus`

### Changed

* `USER_DATA` item is appended to runtime core API object `runtimeStateItems`
* Runtime core API method `getRuntimeState` now supports USER_DATA runtime state item to retrieve
  the user data object

## [0.84.*]

### Added

* Runtime core API methods: `showModal`, `hideModal`

### Changed

* **(Breaking)** `exportFormFromIGO` from GlobalEventHandlers renamed to `viewPDF`.

## [0.83.*]

### Added

* Runtime core API methods: `restoreDefaultValues`, `getRuntimeDirtyData`

## [0.82.*]

### Changed

* **(Breaking)** Runtime core API method `getRuntimeState` being called without arguments now
  returns an object with all runtime state items including `previousScreenName`. In previous
  versions of API it returned an object with only `previousScreenName`)
* **(Warning)** Runtime core API methods `getRuntimeData` and `updateRuntimeData` are now deprecated
  and will be removed in one of future releases. `getRuntimeState` and `updateRuntimeState` should
  be used instead
* Runtime core API method `getRuntimeState` now accepts array of items to retrieve as a parameter
  and returns the object with all specified parameters (in previous versions of API it returned an
  object with only `previousScreenName`)
* `loadData` now accepts data to load as a parameter. If it's undefined then `loadData` tries to
  load the data from the server (by default and as it was before).
* Runtime core API method `updateRuntimeData` can now also accept data in format returned by
  `getRuntimeData` method

### Added

* Runtime core API methods: `resetRuntimeState`, `restoreRuntimeState`, `updateRuntimeState`,
  'getFieldByName'
* Runtime core API constant: `runtimeStateItems` which contains names of runtime state items used in
  `getRuntimeState`, `resetRuntimeState`, `restoreRuntimeState`, `updateRuntimeState` API methods
* Runtime core API constant: `sdkEventHandlerNames` which contains names of events that can be
  handled via SDK.

## [0.79.*]

### Changed

The following change is not Breaking unless you use Javascript custom assemblies.

* Two methods in GlobalEventHandlers: `getSourceDropdownData` and `getSourceGridData` are updated to
  load data from javascript custom assembly first. If JS custom assembly is missing, request is sent
  to the server.

## [0.77.*]

### Added

* `callJsCustomAssembly` method introduced in GlobalEventHandlers to handle new action
  `call_js_service` in screen designer

## [0.75.*]

### Changed

The following changes may be considered as breaking if you are using custom stylesheets instead of
default.

* **(Breaking)** Controls styles extracted to separate bundle runtime-controls.css. List of changes:

  * Controls styles extracted from runtime.css to runtime-controls.css
  * Styles for radio and checkbox buttons updated and moved from runtime-bootstrap-overrides.css to
    runtime-controls.css bundle
  * Radio/Checkbox button control's CSS classes updated:

    * btn-group class removed
    * btn-group-vertical class renamed to radio-group-vertical
    * btn and btn-_ classes renamed to input-btn and input-btn-_ classes accordingly

## [0.74.*]

### Changed

* Third party styles extracted from runtime.css to separate style sheets:
  * runtime-bootstrap-theme.css
  * runtime-bootstrap-overrides.css
  * runtime-fonts.css
  * runtime-font-awesome.css
  * runtime-browser-fixes.css

## [0.74.*]

### Changed

* `validateCreditCard` request now sends additional parameters taken from client data:
  ProcessingInstruction, Field1, Field2, FieldDelimiter, LedgerData

## [0.73.*]

### Added

* `callServerProcedure` to GlobalEventHandlers
* `applyEsign` to GlobalEventHandlers
* `declineEsign` to GlobalEventHandlers
* `activateFormPackage` to GlobalEventHandlers
* `exportFormFromIGO` to GlobalEventHandlers
* `sendEmail` to GlobalEventHandlers
* `callLogger` to GlobalEventHandlers

## [0.72.*]

### Added

* css namespacing page
* ability to use namespaced css

## [0.71.*]

> 2017-10-16

### Changed

* jQuery and Bootstrap extracted from runtime.js and are loaded separately in `scripts.html`
* All scripts in `scripts.html` are loaded with `defer` attribute

## [0.70.*]

> 2017-09-07

### Added

* CHANGELOG.md
* expose runtime core api to global scope (`global.App.runtimeCoreApi`)
* add `loadData` to GlobalEventHandlers
* add `refreshUI` method to runtime core api

### Changed

* **(Breaking)** rename `api` to `coreApi` inside `GlobalEventHandlers.js`
* **(Breaking)** `global.GlobalEventHandlers` --> `global.App.__globalEventHandlers`

---

---

## [Example]

> 2055-01-01

### Added

* Support `blabla` on `blabla`
  ### Changed
* Method `meow` should do it louder
* **(Breaking)** Method `alibaba` should show pink `gin` now
  ### Removed
  ### Deprecated
  ### Fixed
  ### Security

name: ./src/runtime/sdk/data format.md
./src/runtime/sdk/css namespacing.md
content:
# CSS namespacing

Runtime package contains css files which could conflict with parent web site ( in case of embedding
runtime app into web page ). Therefore SDK provides ability to resolve such sort of conflicts via
generating `namespaced` css files. In case you have css conflicts you need to manually change path
to css files inside `styles.html`.

Example:

```html
<link href="{{staticsPath}}/assets/runtime-d9062fc459f15ab12eab.css" rel="stylesheet">
```

to

```html
<link href="{{staticsPath}}/assets/namespacedCss/runtime-d9062fc459f15ab12eab.css" rel="stylesheet">
```

Be aware that runtime root html element (which is configured via `global.App.getRuntimeEntryPoint`
see `Embedding runtime into page` section) should have specific css class. By default it's `__` but
maybe changed at screen designer build time.

name: ./src/runtime/sdk/dynamic table.md
content:
# Dynamic table configuration
This file describes configuration and behavior of dynamic table control.

### Table options
- `columns: Array<Column>`
  - Required
  - The core columns configuration object for the entire table.
  - Supports nested `columns` arrays via the column's `columns` key, eg. `[{ title: 'My Group', columns: [...] }]`
- `data: Array<Row>`
  - Required
  - The data array that you want to display on the table.
- `defaultColumn: Partial<Column>`
    - Optional
    - Default options for all columns
    - `options` (see `Column Options` for description):
        - width
        - minWidth
        - maxWidth
        - cssClass
        - show
- `sortBy: Array<Object<name: column.name, desc: Bool>>`
    - Optional
    - An array of sorting objects. If there is more than one object in the array, multi-sorting will be enabled.
Each sorting object should contain an name key with the corresponding column name to sort by. An optional desc key may be set to true or false to indicated ascending or descending sorting for that column.

- `pagination: Object<page: Number, itemsPerPage: Number>`
    - Optional
    - In case when this option is presented table control will draw pagination controls controlled by `page` and `itemsPerPage` passed in option object.

- `disabled: Boolean`
    - Optional
    - Disable table functionality and all editors inside it

### Column Options

The following options are supported on any column object you can pass to `columns`.

- `name: String`
  - **Required** (but optional for grouping columns)
  - This string is used to build the data model for your column.
  - The data returned by an accessor should be **primitive** and sortable.
  - The column's value will be looked up on the original row via that key, eg. If your column's `name` is `firstName` then its value would be read from `row[<rowIndex>]['data']['firstName']`.
- `columns: Array<Column>`
  - Optional
  - A nested array of columns.
  - If defined, the column will act as a header group. Columns can be recursively nested as much as needed.
- `title: String`
  - Optional
  - The name to render in the column header
- `show: Bool`
  - Optional
  - Defaults to `undefined`
  - If set to `true`, will force this column to be visible at all times.
  - If set to `false` will force this column to be hidden at all times.
- `width: Int`
  - Optional
  - Defaults to `150`
  - Specifies the width for the column
- `minWidth: Int`
  - Optional
  - Defaults to `0`
  - Specifies the minimum width for the column
- `maxWidth: Int`
  - Optional
  - Defaults to `0`
  - Specifies the maximum width for the column
- `cssClass: String`
  - Optional
  - Adds css class to a header cell

### Row Options

The following options are supported on any row object you can pass to `data`.
- `rowId: String`
  - **Required**
  - Row identifier. It will be passed within event arguments to identify cell
- `cssClass: String`
  - Optional
  - Adds css class for entire row
- `data: Object<[columnName]: Cell>`
  - Optional
  - Describes cell values and their metadata's
  - Hash map where key is column name (must match to `name` property of the column) and value is cell options object

### Cell Options

The following options are supported on any cell object you can pass to `Row`.

- `cssClass: String`
  - Optional
  - Adds css class for entire row
- `type: <text|textedit|checkbox|radio>`
  - Optional, if not provided then it's `text` by default
  - Defines how the cell must be rendered. It might be just a text or an editor
- `data: <{ value: any}>`
  - Optional
  - Object with data which needs to be presented in a cell or cell editor
  - Value types (of `data.value`) by cell type:
    - text
        - string
    - textedit
        - string
    - checkbox
        - boolean
    - radio
        - boolean

- `editorOptions: <object>`
    - `isRequired <Boolean>`
        - Optional
        - Draws required mark for the editor
    - `isDisabled <Boolean>`
         - Optional
          - Forces editor to be in disabled state


---
## Full example
```js
const tableConfig = {
    defaultColumn: {
        width: 150
    },
    sortBy: [{ name: 'firstName', desc: true }],
    pagination: { page: 1, itemsPerPage: 20 },
    columns: [
        {
            name: 'firstName',
            title: 'First name',
            cssClass: 'dt-first-name-header'
        },
        {
            title: 'Address',
            columns: [
                {
                    name: 'city',
                    title: 'City'
                },
                {
                    name: 'street',
                    title: 'Street',
                    maxWidth: 200
                },
                {
                    name: 'isLeavingThere',
                    title: 'Leaving there?',
                    show: false
                }
            ]
        }
    ],
    data: [
        {
            rowId: '1',
            cssClass: 'dt-even-row',
            data: {
                'firstName': {
                    type: 'text',
                    data: {
                        value: 'Aliaksei'
                    }
                },
                'city': {
                    type: 'textedit',
                    data: {
                        value: 'Minsk'
                    },
                    editorOptions: {
                        isRequired: true
                    }
                },
                'street': {
                    type: 'textedit',
                    data: {
                        value: 'Gaya'
                    }
                },
                'isLeavingThere': {
                    type: 'checkbox',
                    data: {
                        value: true
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    ]
}
```
